# SCNActionable

**Protocol**

Methods for running actions on nodes.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol SCNActionable : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNAction] objects represent reusable, animated actions that can be performed on nodes, such as moving or rotating them. You use an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNAction] class method to create an action and then use methods in the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNActionable] protocol to run the action on a node. This protocol also defines methods for checking whether a node has any currently running actions and, if so, canceling them.

## Running Actions

- **runAction(_:)**: Adds an action to the list of actions executed by the node.
- **runAction(_:completionHandler:)**: Adds an action to the list of actions executed by the node. SceneKit calls the specified block when the action completes.
- **runAction(_:forKey:)**: Adds an identifiable action to the list of actions executed by the node.
- **runAction(_:forKey:completionHandler:)**: Adds an identifiable action to the list of actions executed by the node. SceneKit calls the specified block when the action completes.

## Inspecting a Node’s Running Actions

- **action(forKey:)**: Returns an action associated with a specific key.
- **hasActions**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the node is currently executing any actions.
- **actionKeys**: The list of keys for which the node has attached actions.

## Canceling a Node’s Running Actions

- **removeAction(forKey:)**: Removes an action associated with a specific key.
- **removeAllActions()**: Ends and removes all actions from the node.

## Actions

- **SCNAction**: A simple, reusable animation that changes attributes of any node you attach it to.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

## Conforming Types

- SCNNode
- SCNReferenceNode
